column4: is there anyway to get suspend to work with a wubi installation, or is it not possible?
im not sure its possible..   it may need a actual swap partition.
doesn't suspend just work off the ram?
they alwasy seem to be changeing the names...  I can never which  one is  'to ram' and what one is 'to hard drive'
suspend is to ram, while hibernate is to drive.
i seem to recall the terms 'suspend to ram and suspend to disk' used in the past also.. :)
you got a swap partition of at least your ram size? if not more?
I'm not sure.
time to check i guess. :) free command, and sudo fdisk -l
wubi? i dont think ibernate works with wubi
darn. Maybe I should consider a real partition on my drive.
its a security feature. only the sudo/admin user can do specific things
'gksudo gedit /path/to/file.txt'
why gksudo and not just sudo?
run from a terminal,  getting it to use the dir from some differnt natuilus window?
or what do you mean exactly?
well, if I have a directory open in nautilus, is there a way to run a command on that directory without needing to open terminal and then cd-ing to the directory I already have open in nautilus?
you can drag/drop a directory icon to a terminal  window (or a file) and i think it fills in the path.
still have to open a terminal and then cd then drag and drop. Would be cool if nautilus had a run command feature, maybe in the future it will.
ive seen nauilus variants with terminals embeded in them on the f8 key.
to set up proper variables so gui apps run properly
